title: Facebook shares remain in a bull market supported by Q3 results
text: Facebook (NASDAQ: FB) shares extended its correction from the recent highs above $297, registered in the first week of November but the price of the stock is still near multi-year highs. Facebook reported better-than-expected Q3 results and the company expects that the Q4 ad revenue growth will be even higher.

title: 4 AI Stocks on the Cutting Edge
text: AI stocks present the next frontier of investment, and these four companies are revolutionizing how we interact with their services. The post 4 AI Stocks on the Cutting Edge appeared first on InvestorPlace.

title: France orders Big Tech to pay digital tax despite threat of US tariffs
text: France will require big tech companies to pay its digital services tax, a move that is likely to trigger retaliation by President Donald Trump and pitch the incoming US administration into another trade fight.

title: Tech giants face fines or even break-up if they breach new rules: EU's Breton
text: Tech giants that break new EU rules aimed at curbing their powers could face fines, be ordered to change their practices or even be forced to break up their European businesses, the bloc's digital chief Thierry Breton said on Wednesday.

title: Li Lu's Himalaya Capital Doubled Up on Facebook in 3rd Quarter
text: Li Lu (Trades, Portfolio) is arguably one of the world's most underappreciated value investors. While most investors are aware of Warren Buffett (Trades, Portfolio) and Charlie Munger (Trades, Portfolio), both of whom Li learned from, he is less well-known than the two billionaires.

title: French tax authorities have started demanding U.S. firms pay digital tax: report
text: French tax authorities have started demanding U.S. technology groups pay their 3% digital services tax, the Financial Times reported, citing French officials, company officials and advisers. Facebook and Amazon are among the companies that have received communications, the report said.

title: France is pushing ahead with its tax on US Big Tech after a 10-month standoff with Trump, setting the stage for a trade war over makeup and handbags
text: France has demanded US tech giants pay its new 3% digital services tax, in a re-escalation of a trade war with the White House that was put on hold in January. The Financial Times reported Wednesday that tech companies including Facebook and Amazon had been told by French authorities over the past few days that they need to pay the tax for 2020. The FT cited company executives, advisors, and French officials.

title: French Tax Authorities Nudge Amazon, Facebook To Shell Out Digital Tax: FT
text: Facebook, Inc (NASDAQ: FB) and Amazon.com, Inc (NASDAQ: AMZN) have received a demand of millions of euros from the French tax authorities, the Financial Times reports. What Happened: France seeks to collect "digital tax" for 2020 from the U.S. technology groups.

title: South Korean watchdog fines Facebook $6.1 million for sharing user info without consent
text: A South Korean agency for protecting personal information on Wednesday fined Facebook Inc 6.7 billion won ($6.06 million) and sought a criminal investigation for providing users' personal information to other operators without consent.
